html:
Edison Motors, a Canadian startup, is pushing the boundaries of freight transportation with Topsy, a hybrid semi-truck that blends diesel power with electric efficiency. Unlike fully electric trucks that depend on charging stations, Topsy generates its own electricity, making it an ideal choice for remote and long-haul routes. Watch it in action in this video from Your Future Machine.

At the heart of this innovation is a CAT C9 diesel engine that powers a generator, which then charges onboard batteries and drives the electric axles. This smart hybrid system enhances fuel efficiency while maintaining the power needed for heavy loads.

Performance Breakdown:

  • Twin electric motors (one per axle) delivering 700-800 hp
  • Immense torque: Up to 85,000 lb-ft
  • Regenerative braking to recover energy during descents
  • Extended range without requiring charging station stops

With Topsy already road-tested, Edison Motors is gearing up for its next step—the launch of its production model, Series L. However, an official release date is still on the horizon.
